abstract: It's nice that more women in positions of power feel safe talking about family commitments at work. What about those in less powerful jobs?
snippet: It's nice that more women in positions of power feel safe talking about family commitments at work. What about those in less powerful jobs?
lead_paragraph: The New York Times's otherwise distressing article today on the very real possibility that, in 2012, women's representation in the Senate may shrink for the first time in a generation did contain one real bright spot: Senator Patty Murray of Washington State, elected in the much-vaunted Year of the Woman in 1992, reflected on the contrast of then and now:

headline.main: Can Powerful Women Change the Workplace?
